quoteLast: Its declination on the 31st is 21° 34′ south. Motion for month direct and amounting to 22° 28′. Diameter decreases from 4.6″ to 4.4″.
title: The Chautauquan, Vol. 05, October 1884, No. 1
author: Chautauqua Literary and Scientific Circle; Chautauqua Institution; Flood, Theodore L., 1842- [Editor]

title: Plays

quoteFirst: I pushed across, stepping over a basket, and jostled by a woman with poultry and vegetables. It was, however, seven or
quoteLast: when I arrived at the church; the doors of the south porch were open. Within I heard the sound of voices--or, at least, of one voice. I looked in.
title: The Lady of Lynn
author: Besant, Walter, 1836-1901

quoteLast: , from Lyons, another New York and Chicago railway post-office train passes, but, owing to different connections, disposes of it differently: from this railway post-office a pouch containing a similarly addressed letter, with other mail, is delivered at Albany for the Boston and Albany railway post-office, due to leave Springfield, Massachusetts, at 7.15 A.M.; this pouch is conveyed from Albany in the baggage-car attached to an express-train, which train, passing Westfield, connects at Springfield with the 7.15 A.M. railway post-office train East.
title: The Bay State Monthly — Volume 1, No. 1, January, 1884
author: Various
